metadata.Title: CVE-2023-43804 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: urllib3 is a user-friendly HTTP client library for Python. urllib3 doesn't treat the `Cookie` HTTP header special or provide any helpers for managing cookies over HTTP, that is the responsibility of the user. However, it is possible for a user to specify a `Cookie` header and unknowingly leak information via HTTP redirects to a different origin if that user doesn't disable redirects explicitly. This issue has been patched in urllib3 version 1.26.17 or 2.0.5.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> On focal and earlier, the python-pip package bundles python-urllib3 binaries when built. After updating python-urllib3, a no-change rebuild of python-pip is required. On jammy and later, python-urllib3 is bundled in the python-pip package and needs to be patched.

criterions.comment: python-pip: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
python-urllib3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
